column4: Any ideas? Local domain vs internet domain... should they differ?
Does it make it even more complex to have your local domain be the same as the global (internet) set domain?
are your internal machines reachable through the FQDN for which you have dns set up?
to put it another way: if you don't intend those machines to be directly reachable, it makes no difference what the fqdn is (since they don't appear in an authoritative dns).
